displayName.text: Consulate General of the Republic of Korea

formattedAddress: 460 Park Ave 6th Fl, New York, NY 10022, USA

authorAttributions.displayName: Consulate General of the Republic of Korea

adrFormatAddress: 460 Park Ave 6th Fl, New York, NY 10022, USA

originalText.text:
Their website is missing critical information for the F-4 Visa application process:

1. You need to make an appointment to apply for F-4 visa. They only take F-4 applications in-person ONLY.
2. The appointment can be only made through this website: https://consul.mofa.go.kr/ which ONLY opens on EVERY MONDAY at 9AM. If you see potential dates grayed out, that doesn't mean they are taken. It means you are just not able to select them OUTSIDE of Monday. Do not attempt to call the number on this website because nobody is going to answer it.
3. The office opens from 9-11am and 1-3pm. NOT 9-4pm.

text.text:
Their website is missing critical information for the F-4 Visa application process:

1. You need to make an appointment to apply for F-4 visa. They only take F-4 applications in-person ONLY.
2. The appointment can be only made through this website: https://consul.mofa.go.kr/ which ONLY opens on EVERY MONDAY at 9AM. If you see potential dates grayed out, that doesn't mean they are taken. It means you are just not able to select them OUTSIDE of Monday. Do not attempt to call the number on this website because nobody is going to answer it.
3. The office opens from 9-11am and 1-3pm. NOT 9-4pm.

originalText.text: First visit here. Read all the reviews and was skeptical of the service I will receive, however it was the complete opposite. Security guards at the lobby were so courteous and helpful. Security lady on the 6th floor was very professional and patient (I was slow in moving around because of injured back). She was also able to handle other visitors who tried to cut lines or seemed confused about where they should go. She directed traffic very well! My brother and I went to the lady in the left side (second booth). Didn’t catch her name but she had short hair, about 5’3-5’4. She spoke Korean and English (whew, my Korean is not fluent enough to fill our Korean language documents). She was able to help me complete the form, answered any questions I had, and was able to submit the application in a timely manner. Wish I was able to buy her a cup of coffee! It was only 9:40am but she was able to complete our request quickly. Thank you for your knowledge and assistance! My experience was very positive!!

originalText.text: Came here last week to get proof of a passport document name, I had to make an appt through their website online. No one picks up anymore, so if you want to visit, you will need to make an appt online, create user ID, and pw. They were very helpful once you're in the building. There is a security guard that you need to pass through to get in the door. Almost feels like you're at an airport.  Our appt was for 10:30am but we were able to get everything done before that time. Thank God. We didn't have to wait either.  The young lady was very helpful and polite. Thanks, but 4 stars because no one picks up the phone anymore or confirms your appt close to the date by email. Other than that, it was a pleasant visit.

originalText.text:
As a Korean American I am appalled and embarrassed at how rude they are. I would give them 0 stars if I could.

I went to the embassy because I could not find an online visa application for a friend who is a non US citizen, green card holder. When I came to the counter to ask about the visa application, the employee rolled her eyes during the whole interaction. She gave me a paper copy and told me the information is online. When I asked her for the online visa application information she looked at me disparagingly and then wrote some information in Korean, even though our interaction was in English.

After this interaction, I wanted to cancel my trip to Korea. A truly negative experience.

originalText.text: To the unbelievably rude woman (in her 40s) who made my wife cry today. I hope you get fired and sent back to Korea. You know who you are and I can see how many people complain about you.
